items.title: CMA investigating anticipated acquisition of HashiCorp by IBM
items.description: The United Kingdom’s Competition and Markets Authority announced it is investigating the anticipated acquisition by IBM (IBM) of HashiCorp (HCP). “The CMA is considering whether it is or may be the case that this transaction, if carried into effect, will result in the creation of a relevant merger situation under the merger provisions of the Enterprise Act 2002 and, if so, whether the creation of that situation may be expected to result in a substantial lessening of competition within any market

items.title: IBM’s $6.4bn HashiCorp acquisition under UK antitrust review
items.description: The CMA is assessing whether the merger could “result in a substantial lessening of competition within any market or markets in the United Kingdom for goods or services”.

items.title: Revolutionizing Pharma: The Impact of Big Data and Technological Advances on the Pharma Industry
items.author: Globe Newswire
items.description: The report examines the trends shaping the big data in pharma landscape, including healthcare, technology, macroeconomic, and regulatory factors. It provides insights into leading players, future disruptors, and key drugs and markets in the pharmaceutical industry.
